intro: Galium linifolium, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft, silvery appearance. Galium linifolium is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
